segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
4. Kaḷāra the Aristocrat
31. What Has Come to Be
At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta,
“Sāriputta, this was said in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Ajita’:
‘Those who have comprehended the teaching,
and the many kinds of trainees here—
dear sir, you are alert;
when questioned, please tell me their conduct.’

segments.pli: Imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṅkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
segments.en: How should we see the detailed meaning of this brief statement?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.
segments.en: When he said this, Sāriputta kept silent.

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi … pe …
segments.en: For a second time …

segments.pli: dutiyampi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.
Tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: For a third time …

segments.pli: Imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṅkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
Tatiyampi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.
segments.en: Sāriputta kept silent.
“Sāriputta, do you see that this has come to be?”
“Sir, one truly sees with right wisdom that this has come to be.

segments.pli: Bhūtamidanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā bhūtassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: Seeing this, one is practicing for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding what has come to be.
One truly sees with right wisdom that it originated with that as fuel.

segments.pli: Tadāhārasambhavanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā āhārasambhavassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: Seeing this, one is practicing for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the fuel for its origination.

segments.pli: Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.
segments.en: One truly sees with right wisdom that when that fuel ceases, what has come to be is liable to cease.

segments.pli: Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā nirodhadhammassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: Seeing this, one is practicing for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding what is liable to cease.
In this way one is a trainee.
And what, sir, is one who has comprehended the teaching?
Sir, one truly sees with right wisdom that this has come to be.

segments.pli: Bhūtamidanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā bhūtassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti.
segments.en: Seeing this, one is freed by not grasping through disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding what has come to be.
One truly sees with right wisdom that it originated with that as fuel.

segments.pli: Tadāhārasambhavanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā āhārasambhavassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti.
segments.en: Seeing this, one is freed by not grasping through disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the fuel for its origination.

segments.pli: Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.
segments.en: One truly sees with right wisdom that when that fuel ceases, what has come to be is liable to cease.

segments.pli: Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā nirodhadhammassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti.
segments.en: Seeing this, one is freed by not grasping through disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding what is liable to cease.
In this way one has comprehended the teaching.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhante, yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ pārāyane ajitapañhe:
segments.en: Sir, regarding what was said in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Ajita’:
‘Those who have comprehended the teaching,
and the many kinds of trainees here—
dear sir, you are alert;
when questioned, please tell me their conduct.’

segments.pli: Imassa khvāhaṃ, bhante, saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmī”ti.
segments.en: This is how I understand the detailed meaning of what was said in brief.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, sāriputta, bhūtamidanti, sāriputta, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.
segments.en: “Good, good, Sāriputta!” (The Buddha repeated all of Sāriputta’s explanation, concluding:)

segments.pli: Bhūtamidanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā bhūtassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
Tadāhārasambhavanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā āhārasambhavassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.
Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā nirodhadhammassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
Bhūtamidanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā bhūtassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti.
Tadāhārasambhavanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā āhārasambhavassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti.
Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.
Tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammanti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññā disvā nirodhadhammassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti.
Iti kho, sāriputta, yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ pārāyane ajitapañhe:
Imassa kho, sāriputta, saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti.
segments.en: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what was said in brief.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha asks Sāriputta to explain a verse from “The Questions of Ajita” in the Parāyana (Snp 5.2). At first, Sāriputta hesitates, but proceeds when the Buddha indicates he is looking for an answer in terms of conditionality.
